message.content:
We need to look for the transactions that record depreciation. In the provided transactions (shown in a single table) there are two records whose type is “Depreciation”:

• The first depreciation transaction is "Depreciation20240101001" with an amount of 45753.240000000005 (which we will round to 45753.24).

• The second depreciation transaction is "Depreciation20240201002" with an amount of 47117.43.

Because there is no previously recorded depreciation (i.e. nothing from before the start date, as the “Initial” entries do not include any depreciation) the accumulated depreciation “initial value” is 0.00. When we add the depreciation amounts during the period, the final accumulated depreciation becomes:

  45753.24 + 47117.43 = 92870.67

Thus, the accumulated depreciation value on the balance sheet is 0.00 at the beginning and 92870.67 at the end.

Below is the answer in the requested JSON format.

 
```json
{"solution": {"Accumulated Depreciation Initial Value": "0.00", "Accumulated Depreciation End Value": "92870.67"} }
```
